title: python_default_init behavior incorrect when auto generating aten functions
body_html:
Any non-empty input defined in the python_default_init in the ATen's native_functions.yaml will generate a default 'None' here, see generation logic when generating python functions/methods in pytorch.

        if arg.get('python_default_init') is not None:
            default = 'None'

It should not be a correct behavior for other default args when generating the functions as it does not give the correct default values to the function.
body_text:
Any non-empty input defined in the python_default_init in the ATen's native_functions.yaml will generate a default 'None' here, see generation logic when generating python functions/methods in pytorch.
        if arg.get('python_default_init') is not None:
            default = 'None'
It should not be a correct behavior for other default args when generating the functions as it does not give the correct default values to the function.
body:
Any non-empty input defined in the python_default_init in the ATen's native_functions.yaml will generate a default 'None' here, see [generation logic](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/tools/autograd/gen_python_functions.py#L729) when generating python functions/methods in pytorch.

```python
        if arg.get('python_default_init') is not None:
            default = 'None'
``` 

It should not be a correct behavior for other default args when generating the functions as it does not give the correct default values to the function.
